metadata.title: CVE-2014-0117 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The mod_proxy module in the Apache HTTP Server 2.4.x before 2.4.10, when areverse proxy is enabled, allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (child-process crash) via a crafted HTTP Connection header.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0117` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1').
